page.title: 14Farming.
page.content: In Holwell Hyde Lane we found a place to fish.A man said that he went fishing there about three times a week.He found it very quiet and peaceful.Further up there was a farm with cows in the field. The crop that is growing in the two fields is barley.There were hedges on either side of our walk;the path was very grassy with two tracks.There is also wildlife;we saw blackbirds, butterflies and a fieldmouse.The area has large fields with trees like oak and hawthorn separating them. Holwell Court farm is run by Mr Davies.It is a tenant farm owned by Redlands.The crops grown on it are wheat ,barley ,oats and grass.Mr Davies keeps most of his animals, which are cows, in Hertford.His farm covers 50 hectares,producing beef and cereals.
